intro: Gnaphalium uniflorum, commonly known as the single-flower cudweed, is a small annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features a basal rosette of narrow, silver-haired leaves. The plant produces a single, small, daisy-like flower with white petals and yellow central disc florets. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and along stream banks. Gnaphalium uniflorum is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
